# cDNA for eRAD {#sec-molecular-eRAD}

## Introduction

-   **Purpose**: This procedure describes how to synthesize cDNA for use with eRAD (expression RAD-seq).
-   **Procedure Type**: Molecular
-   **Species**: N/A
-   **Author**: Susie Bassham
-   **Date Created**: Unknown

::: {.callout-warning title="Safety"}
**Personal Protective Equipment (PPE):**

- Lab coat
- Safety glasses
- Nitrile gloves

**Chemical Safety:**

- Handle DTT with care; it is an irritant and has a strong odor
- Handle EDTA with care; it is an irritant
- Work in a well-ventilated area
- RNase-free technique required; wear gloves at all times
:::

## Materials

-   Thermal cycler or heat block
-   Ice
-   Microcentrifuge tubes (RNase-free)
-   Pipettes and RNase-free tips
-   Zymo DNA column

## Solutions

-   2 µl Random Primer Mix (60 µM, NEB; a mix of random hexamers, anchored-dT primers, and 1 mM dNTPs)
-   0.8 µl 10 mM dNTP mix
-   X µl up to 0.5 µg mRNA
-   Nuclease-free water (if necessary)
-   4 µl 5x First-Strand Buffer (Invitrogen)
-   1 µl 0.1 M DTT (Invitrogen)
-   1 µl RNase inhibitor, e.g., RNAseOUT (Invitrogen)
-   1 µl Superscript III reverse transcriptase (200 u/µl, Invitrogen)
-   15 µl 10x Second-Strand Synthesis Reaction Buffer (B6117S, NEB)
-   3 µl 10 mM dNTPs
-   1 µl E. coli ligase (10 u/µl)
-   4 µl E. coli DNA Polymerase I (10 u/µl)
-   0.4 µl E. coli RNase H (5 u/µl)
-   3.3 µl (10 u) T4 DNA polymerase (3 u/µl, NEB)
-   10 µl 0.5 M EDTA

## Procedure

### First Strand Synthesis {#sec-first-strand-synthesis}

1.  Combine:

    -   2 µl Random Primer Mix (60 µM, NEB; a mix of random hexamers, anchored-dT primers, and 1 mM dNTPs)
    -   0.8 µl 10 mM dNTP mix
    -   X µl up to 0.5 µg mRNA
    -   Nuclease-free water (if necessary) to bring total to 12 µl

2.  Heat to 65°C for 5 min., then place on ice

3.  Collect contents at bottom of tube by brief centrifugation.

4.  Add:

    -   4 µl 5x First-Strand Buffer (Invitrogen)
    -   1 µl 0.1 M DTT (Invitrogen)
    -   1 µl RNase inhibitor, e.g., RNAseOUT (Invitrogen)
    -   1 µl Superscript III reverse transcriptase (200 u/µl, Invitrogen)

5.  Mix by gentle aspiration

6.  Incubate at 25°C for 10 min.

::: {.callout-note title="Note"}
Reaction can be scaled up to accommodate more starting RNA. This protocol continues with second strand synthesis as described in @sec-molecular-dbl_strand_cDNA.
:::

7.  **Synthesis**: Incubate at 50°C for 50 min.

8.  **Inactivation**: Heat to 85°C for 5 min. Chill on ice, collect contents to bottom by short spin.

9.  Continue with second strand synthesis, end repair, and restriction digestion as needed for your eRAD library preparation (see @sec-molecular-RADseq for complete RAD-seq protocols).

::: {.callout-note title="Storage"}
cDNA can be stored at -20°C for several months or at -80°C for long-term storage.
:::
